TFTCG Aequitas Draft FAQ
FAQ / Wave 5 / Battle Cards /
View On FortressMaximus.io

Hull Down

  1. If a character flips a hybrid battle icon during attack/defense and the character is not the relevant trait, is it considered a battle card with no battle icons? [Source: Aequitas]
    No. If, for example, Barricade flipped a Hull Down, it is considered a battle card with 1 orange battle icon for the purposes of any flip effects and not a card with no battle icons. Of course, as Barricade is not a Tank, it does not provide him with +1 to his attack.
  2. What does 'battle effect when flipped' mean? [Source: Community]
    This is a term introduced in Wave 5's explanatory text, for example on Hull Down. It refers to the effect flipped battle icons provide to the total attack or defense of the battling characters. For example, when flipping Hull Down on an attack, only a character with the Tank trait on its current mode would receive the battle effect of +1 Attack from Hull Down's battle icon. Note that an orange battle icon was still flipped, so any abilities that depend on the color of flipped battle icons would still have seen an orange battle icon.
